title: With everything moving to the cloud (music, gaming, movies, etc.), is it possible that streaming could be the future of media? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s very possible that streaming is the future. The technology is getting better every generation. Though some people will disagree with me, that’s their opinion This year 2020, is getting started, and it starts with these services: Netflix, Disney Plus, HBO Max, Google Stadia, Microsoft XCloud, Spotify, YouTube Music, and others. Though, it will take about 10 or more years from now for streaming to actually kill off cable, consoles, and other hardware. That’s all

Well, let’s starts with the fact that music and movies are already predominantly consumed via streaming services. That just leaves gaming and gaming is a tricky beast, because to facilitate an optimal gaming experience there needs to be low ping/latency between the user and data centre that is hosting the game. For people in major cities and or those within 800km of relevant infrastructure, game streaming may in fact become the most popular way to consume games. Looking into the future, game streaming will probably be the most popular way to consume games within 12 years or less.
